title: 1st sem SGPA
content: Do they consider 2 labs( 1 credit each ) while calculating sgpa? so can i expect some increase in my sgpa after their consideration?

comments.body: I think they were already considered
The SGPA considers every component and is calculated after accounting everything
in provisional results they have displayed 22 credits taken....but with labs its gonna be 24 credits right??

So for python what they did was 
Score out of 100 marks(ISA+ESA) + score out of 20 ((lab component) )
And that total score out of 120 is reduced back to 100. 
This is then considered as a 5 credit course and your grade will be multiplied with 5. 
I think the same thing was done for chem as well
But they are showing only 22 credits taken. But it is actually 24 credits.

Bruhhhhh 


There are only 22 credits in first sem where'd 24 credits come off from

The 5 credit courses include these lab credits , so there's no "extra" lab credits or anything

Bruhhhhh 


There are only 22 credits in first sem where'd 24 credits come off from

The 5 credit courses include these lab credits , so there's no "extra" lab credits or anything

For us lab grade was different from the subject grade in the first year. 
But Jawahar said that there cannot be such a stark contrast lab and regular subject grade so now they have merged the 2 and give one grade accounting for both.
The 5 credit courses are 4 for theory and 1 for lab
